name: Civil service competency framework
description: Competency framework to support the Civil Service Reform Plan and the new performance management system.

abilities.name: Gathering information from a range of relevant sources inside and outside their Department to inform own work
Understanding what is required of them in their role and how this contributes to team and Departmental priorities
Keeping up to date with a broad set of issues relating to the work of the Department
Being alert to emerging issues and trends which might impact or benefit own and team’s work
Making and recording effective decisions following the appropriate decision making criteria, framework or guidance
Demonstrating accountability and making unbiased decisions
Making decisions when they are needed, even if they prove difficult or unpopular
Communicating in a way that meets and anticipates the customer’s requirements and gives a favourable impression of the Civil Service
Explaining clearly to customers what can be done
Making effective use of project management skills and techniques to deliver outcomes, including identifying risks and mitigating actions
Working in an organised manner using own knowledge and expertise to deliver on time and to standard
Creating regular reviews of what and who is required to make a project/activity successful and make ongoing improvements
Being interested and positive about what they and the team are trying to achieve
Successfully managing, supporting and stretching self and team to deliver agreed goals and objectives
